segments.text: My attention keeps returning to that poor boy on the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I really can't help but feel a sense of dread watching him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's legs are splayed out, tilted precariously on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It looks incredibly unstable, almost like it's about to tip backward at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's reaching so far up, straining to get those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm so afraid he's going to lose his balance and fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if he hits his head on the counter or even worse, the floor?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl seems oblivious to the danger, just focused on the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This situation is genuinely making me feel quite anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could warn them or somehow stabilize that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a dangerous position for a child.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is a real accident waiting to happen, and it worries me immensely.
segments.speaker: PAR
